trans-unit.source: Represents a single ink stroke.
A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is the data object that is collected from a pointing device, such as a tablet pen or a mouse.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> can be created and manipulated programmatically, and can be represented visually on an ink-enabled element, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> contains information about both its position and appearance.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> property is a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects that specifies the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> property specifies a stroke's appearance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
stylusPoints is `null`.
stylusPoints is empty..
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object that specifies the appearance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
stylusPoints is `null`.
-or-
drawingAtrributes is `null`.
stylusPoints is empty.
Adds a custom property to the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
This method is useful if you need to store extra information in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
The unique identifier for the property.
The value of the custom property.
propertyData must be of type , , , , , , , , , , , , , or an array of these data types, except , which is not allowed.
The propertyData argument is not one of the allowed data types listed in the `Parameters` section.
Returns a deep copy of the existing <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
The properties of an object that is a deep copy of another object have the same values as the properties of the original object.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object contains the specified custom property.
The unique identifier for the property.
Returns `true` if the custom property exists; otherwise, returns `false`.
Renders the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object based upon the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object onto which the stroke will be rendered.

Renders the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object based upon the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object onto which the stroke will be rendered.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object defining the attributes of the stroke that is drawn.

Renders the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref>.
Override the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawCore%2A> method to perform custom drawing when you inherit from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object onto which the stroke will be rendered.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object defining the attributes of the stroke that is drawn.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
These attributes, such as color and width, are applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> object as it is drawn.
Changing <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributes%2A> causes the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributesChanged> event to fire.
The set value is `null`.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributes"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object change.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs> contains information about the property that changed.
You can compare the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs.PropertyGuid%2A> property against the members of <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributeIds> to see which value changed.
Occurs when the drawing attributes of a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object are replaced.
Returns the stylus points the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> uses when <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve"></xref> is `true`.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetBezierStylusPoints%2A> method returns a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that contains the stylus points that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> uses when the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributes%2A> property is set to `true`.
To get the stylus points that are used when <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A> is set to `false`, use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> property.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that contains the stylus points along the spine of a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> when <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve"></xref> is `true`
Retrieves the bounding box for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> structure defining the bounding box for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
Returns segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are within the specified bounds.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> that contains strokes that represent the segments of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> that is within `lassoPoints`.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> does not change the original <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> method connects the first and last points in `lassoPoints` to create the lasso.
The points that specify the line which defines where to clip.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that contains copies of the segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are within the specified bounds.
Returns segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are within the specified rectangle.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> that contains strokes that represent the segments of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> that is within `bounds`.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> does not change the original <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the area to clip.
A that contains copies of the segments of the current that are within the bounds of bounds.
Returns segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are outside the specified bounds.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> that contains strokes that represent the segments of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> that are outside of `lassoPoints`.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> does not change the original <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetClipResult%2A> method connects the first and last points in `lassoPoints` to create the lasso.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that specifies the area to erase.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that contains the segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are outside the specified bounds.
Returns segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are outside the specified rectangle.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> that contains strokes that represent the segments of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> that are outside of `bounds`.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> does not change the original <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the area to erase.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that contains the segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that are outside the bounds of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>.

Returns the segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> after it is dissected by the designated path using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> method uses `eraserShape` to hit test the stroke along `eraserPath` and returns a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> that represent dissected segments.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetEraseResult%2A> does not change the original <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that specifies the path that dissects the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> that specifies the shape of the eraser.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that contains copies of the segments of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> after it is dissected by the specified path.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetGeometry%2A> method to get a <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> to customize the shape of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
Consider caching the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> to avoid calling <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetGeometry%2A> multiple times, which may impact performance.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetGeometry%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTip%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform%2A> properties of `drawingAttributes` to determine the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry>.
Consider caching the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> to avoid calling <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetGeometry%2A> multiple times, which may impact performance.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> that determines the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
Retrieves the property data for the specified GUID.
The unique identifier for the property.
An `object` containing the property data.
propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the .
Retrieves the GUIDs of any custom properties associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
An array of <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> objects.
Returns a value that indicates whether current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> intersects the specified point.
This method behaves the same way as the overloaded <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.HitTest%28System.Windows.Point%2CSystem.Double%29> method does when `diameter` is 1.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> to hit test.
`true` if point intersects the current stroke; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> is within the specified bounds.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.HitTest%2A> method connects the first and last points in `lassoPoints` to create the lasso.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the bounds of the area to hit test.
The percentage of the length of the , that must be in lassoPoints for the to be considered hit.
`true` if the current stroke is within the specified bounds; otherwise `false`.
Returns whether the specified path intersects the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.HitTest%2A> method uses `stylusShape` to hit test the stroke along `eraserPath`.
The path that stylusShape follows for hit testing
The shape of path with which to hit test.
`true` if stylusShape intersects the current stroke; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> intersects the specified area.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that defines the center of the area to hit test.
The diameter of the area to hit test.
`true` if the specified area intersects the current stroke; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> is within the bounds of the specified rectangle.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the bounds of the area to hit test.
The percentage of the length of the , that must be in percentageWithinBounds for the to be considered hit..
`true` if the current stroke is within the bounds of bounds; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the appearance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> changes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> handles the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.Invalidated> event and calls the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawCore%2A> method.

If you inherit from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> class and your stroke's appearance is based on a custom state, you must call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.OnInvalidated%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.Invalidated> event.
Allows derived classes to modify the default behavior of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributesChanged"></xref> event.
When overriding this method in a derived class, call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.OnDrawingAttributesChanged%2A> method of the base class so that registered delegates receive the event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
Allows derived classes to modify the default behavior of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributesReplaced"></xref> event.
When overriding this method in a derived class, call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.OnDrawingAttributesReplaced%2A> method of the base class so that registered delegates receive the event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributesReplacedEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.Invalidated"></xref> event.

If you inherit from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> class and your stroke's appearance is based on a custom state, you must call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.OnInvalidated%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.Invalidated> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> handles the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.Invalidated> event and calls the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawCore%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when any <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> property changes.
The event data that describes the property that changed, as well as old and new values.
Allows derived classes to modify the default behavior of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.PropertyDataChanged"></xref> event.
When overriding this method in a derived class, call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.OnPropertyDataChanged%2A> method of the base class so that registered delegates receive the event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPointsChanged"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPointsReplaced"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusPointsReplacedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the custom properties on a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object changes.
Deletes a custom property from the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> object.
The unique identifier for the property.
Returns the stylus points of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.

To get the stylus points that are used when the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributes%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetBezierStylusPoints%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> property must have at least one <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> in it.

If you try to assign an empty <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> to <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A>, or remove all the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects from <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A>, an exception occurs.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that contains the stylus points that represent the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints"></xref> property changes.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints"></xref> property is assigned a new <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
Performs a transformation based upon the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> object represents a 3x3 matrix used for transformations in two-dimensional space.
Each point of the Stroke object is transformed by the supplied Matrix.
For example if the original Point.X value is 100, the original Point.Y value is 55, and the transformation Matrix.Scale(0.5, 0.5), the new Point.X value is 50 and the new Point.Y value is 27.5.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> object defining the transformation.
`true` to apply the transformation to the tip of the stylus; otherwise, `false`.
